messages.subject: Re: New to the forum...
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks, Jim.  I m looking forward to contributing here as well. I am also happy to hear that you are thinking of updating your site in the not-too-distant
messages.messageBody:
Thanks, Jim. I'm looking forward to contributing here as well.
I am also happy to hear that you are thinking of updating your site
in the not-too-distant future. Such a superb site, and I'm sure the
new images of mimi/tekkotsu will be invaluable for those of us who
are big on Owari and Kanayama...

Steve

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] New to the forum...
messages.msgSnippet: Welcome, Steven.  Looking forward to hearing more from you. Jim Greetings everyone, I am new to the forum here, at least as a contributor...  I have lurked
messages.messageBody:
Welcome, Steven. Looking forward to hearing more from you.

Jim



Greetings everyone,

I am new to the forum here, at least as a contributor... I
have "lurked" here for some time, and finally decided it was time I
joined you all in your excellent discussions. As a "tsuba man," I
have especially appreciated the recent activity on this site. You
are all so knowledgeable and generous with your thoughts and
comments---it certainly helps someone like me who is relatively new
to tsuba.

I have very much enjoyed the Kantei of recent days, and the
excellent photographs of tekkotsu that Jim has provided. It really
helps to have such images for reference.

Fascinating thoughts, too, on the matter of aesthetic valuation of
tsuba in pre-Edo times. Jim's refereces to the tea ware of the day
are intriguing as well.

Anyway, I just wanted to introduce myself and express my
appreciation for the great activity on the board. I will look
forward to seeing more, and to contributing a few words here and
there. Best to all...

Steven


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: New to the forum...
messages.msgSnippet: Greetings everyone, I am new to the forum here, at least as a contributor...  I have lurked here for some time, and finally decided it was time I joined you
messages.messageBody:
Greetings everyone,

I am new to the forum here, at least as a contributor... I
have "lurked" here for some time, and finally decided it was time I
joined you all in your excellent discussions. As a "tsuba man," I
have especially appreciated the recent activity on this site. You
are all so knowledgeable and generous with your thoughts and
comments---it certainly helps someone like me who is relatively new
to tsuba.

I have very much enjoyed the Kantei of recent days, and the
excellent photographs of tekkotsu that Jim has provided. It really
helps to have such images for reference.

Fascinating thoughts, too, on the matter of aesthetic valuation of
tsuba in pre-Edo times. Jim's refereces to the tea ware of the day
are intriguing as well.

Anyway, I just wanted to introduce myself and express my
appreciation for the great activity on the board. I will look
forward to seeing more, and to contributing a few words here and
there. Best to all...

Steven
